text:
```julia> r = Dict("a" => 10, "b" => Dict("c" => nothing, "d" => "hello"), "e" => missing)
Dict{String, Any} with 3 entries:
  "e" => missing
  "b" => Dict{String, Union{Nothing, String}}("c"=>nothing, "d"=>"hello")
  "a" => 10

julia> JSON3.write(r)
"{\"e\":null,\"b\":{\"c\":null,\"d\":\"hello\"},\"a\":10}"```
is there an option so that if the the value is nothing it's not written?

elements.text:
julia> r = Dict("a" => 10, "b" => Dict("c" => nothing, "d" => "hello"), "e" => missing)
Dict{String, Any} with 3 entries:
  "e" => missing
  "b" => Dict{String, Union{Nothing, String}}("c"=>nothing, "d"=>"hello")
  "a" => 10

julia> JSON3.write(r)
"{\"e\":null,\"b\":{\"c\":null,\"d\":\"hello\"},\"a\":10}"
is there an option so that if the the value is nothing it's not written?

text: so in this example "c" wouldn't appear in the written output

elements.text: so in this example "c" wouldn't appear in the written output

text:
you can use `omitempties` I think; quoting form the docs:
> `StructTypes.omitempties(::Type{MyType}) = (:field1, :field2)`: specify fields of `MyType` that shouldn’t be written if they are “empty”, provided as a `Tuple` of `Symbol`s. This only affects writing. If a field is a collection (AbstractDict, AbstractArray, etc.) and `isempty(x) === true`, then it will not be written. If a field is `#undef`, it will not be written. If a field is `nothing`, it will not be written.
<https://quinnj.github.io/JSON3.jl/dev/#Struct-API>

text: Yes, for structs overloading a `StructTypes.Struct` or `StructTypes.Mutable`, you can also overload `StructTypes.omitempties`. Currently, there's no option for supporting this on `Dict`s, though it should be pretty easy to add. If someone wouldn't mind opening an issue at the JSON3 repo, I could get to it this week sometime.
